dct_description_sm: A sublayer from migration routes for the five largest refugee populations in modern US history. This layer focuses on Afghanistan refugee migrations to the top 10 destination countries during the course of the Soviet-Afghan War from 1981 to 1991.
Source data: “Population Statistics.” The UN Refugee Agency, http://popstats.unhcr.org/en/persons_of_concern. Accessed 7 June 2016.
dct_rights_sm: Data may be freely downloaded for research, study, or teaching, but must be cited appropriately. Re-release of the data, or incorporation of the data into a commercial product, is allowed only with explicit permission.
